author: James Joyce
text: Dear Lord Carlow: Has Ibsen’s Ghost gone astray or have you not my address. There is a label on the back of this note. And, by the way, I see there is a typist’s blunder in line 4 of stanza 3 which should read; ‘When the wise sire knows which is which’ and not ‘When the wise child etc’ If you can’t send a copy I would like to read the sheets which I would return. Sincerely yours James Joyce
